articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Russia should clearly state its willingness to use nuclear weapons against countries that "support NATO aggression in Ukraine", according to an influential foreign policy hawk who is pressing President Vladimir Putin to adopt a more assertive nuclear posture towards the West.
articles.title: Russian hawk pushes case for Putin to toughen policy on nuclear weapons

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian drones inflicted significant damage to the northern Ukrainian town of Konotop's energy infrastructure in an overnight attack that injured at least 14 people and cut electricity to the settlement, local officials said on Thursday.
articles.title: Russian drones pound power system in Sumy region town, 14 people hurt, Ukraine says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Flood water levels of the Red River in Hanoi are forecast to be little changed until at least early Friday, the government's weather agency said on Thursday, and several parts of the city will remain inundated.
articles.title: Hanoi flood levels to be little changed, parts to remain inundated - weather agency

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian judge ordered the trial of three lawyers for the late opposition leader Alexei Navalny closed to journalists and the public on Thursday, citing the potential for provocations from Navalny's allies abroad, an independent news site reported.
articles.title: Russian judge bars observers from 'extremism' trial of Navalny's lawyers, says Mediazona

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez on Thursday met Venezuela's fugitive opposition leader Edmundo Gonzalez in Madrid, a day after the lower house of Spain's parliament voted to recognise Gonzalez as the winner of a presidential election in July.
articles.title: Spain's Sanchez greets Venezuelan opposition leader Gonzalez in Madrid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy has dismissed a Chinese-Brazilian peace initiative for the war in Ukraine as "destructive", and complained that Kyiv had not been involved in the process.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy dismisses 'destructive' China-Brazil peace initiative

articles.author: Panarat Thepgumpanat, Chayut Setboonsarng
articles.description: Thailand deployed military special forces in the northern province of Chiang Rai on Thursday after flooding marooned thousands that authorities are trying to reach with boats and helicopters.
articles.title: Flooding in Thailand maroons thousands in northern province

articles.author: Imad Creidi, Bassam Masoud
articles.description: Evacuated to Qatar from the chaos of Gaza, nine-year-old Palestinian Mahmoud Youssef Ajjour still dreams of becoming a pilot one day despite losing his arms in an Israeli rocket attack.
articles.title: Gazan child amputee dreams big after evacuation to Qatar

articles.author: Olena Harmash
articles.description: After spending years in what she described as "boring, sedentary" roles in the offices of several Ukrainian companies, Liliia Shulha landed her dream job as a truck driver with Ukraine's leading retailer, Fozzy Group.
articles.title: Ukraine businesses hire more women and teens as labour shortages bite

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: About 45 Indian nationals have been discharged from the Russian army and efforts are under way to get a further 50 Indians released, a spokesperson for the Indian Foreign Ministry said on Thursday.
articles.title: Russia discharges 45 Indians fighting in its army
